content:
Yes, I can provide a list of 50 girls who played important roles before turning 18. Please note that this list is not exhaustive and there are many more young women and girls throughout history who have made significant contributions.

1. Hatshepsut (1508 BCE - 1458 BCE): an Egyptian pharaoh who ruled as a regent for her stepson and eventually took the throne herself at the age of 24.
2. Cleopatra VII (69 BCE - 30 BCE): the last pharaoh of ancient Egypt who took the throne at the age of 18 and played a significant role in the political and cultural life of the Roman Republic.
3. Artemisia I of Caria (5th century BCE): a queen of the ancient Greek city-state of Halicarnassus who fought alongside the Persians in the Greco-Persian Wars at the age of 21.
4. Joan of Arc (1412 CE - 1431 CE): a French heroine who led the French army to several victories during the Hundred Years' War before being captured and executed by the English at the age of 19.
5. Anne Frank (1929 CE - 1945 CE): a young Jewish girl who wrote a diary while hiding with her family during the Nazi occupation of the Netherlands.
6. Claudette Colvin (1939 CE - present): an American civil rights activist who, at the age of 15, refused to give up her seat on a bus in Montgomery, Alabama, nine months before Rosa Parks' more famous act of civil disobedience.
7. Malala Yousafzai (1997 CE - present): a Pakistani education activist who, at the age of 11, began advocating for girls' education and was shot by the Taliban at the age of 15 for her activism.
8. Maria Gaetana Agnesi (1718 CE - 1799 CE): an Italian mathematician who published a comprehensive textbook on calculus at the age of 19.
9. Joan Miró (1893 CE - 1983 CE): a Spanish painter who began drawing at the age of 8 and had her first solo exhibition at the age of 19.
10. Anne Baxter (1923 CE - 1985 CE): an American actress who won an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress at the age of 23.
11. Sarah Chang (1980 CE - present): an American violinist who made her debut with the New York Philharmonic at the age of 8 and has since performed with many other major orchestras around the world.
12. Darya Saltykova (1730 CE - 1801 CE): a Russian noblewoman who became known as the "Devil of Tver" for torturing and killing over 100 of her serfs. She began her crimes at the age of 25.
13. Clelia Duel Mosher (1863 CE - 1940 CE): an American physician and researcher who conducted pioneering studies on women's sexuality and sexual behavior at the age of 17.
14. Asmaa Mahfouz (1985 CE - present): an Egyptian political activist who used social media to organize protests during the 2011 Egyptian revolution at the age of 26.
15. Tegla Loroupe (1973 CE - present): a Kenyan long-distance runner who set world records and won multiple marathons before the age of 18.
16. Sappho (7th century BCE): an ancient Greek poet who wrote lyric poetry and was known for her songs about love and relationships.
17. Hildegard of Bingen (1098 CE - 1179 CE): a German abbess, writer, and composer who began having mystical
